paragraphs.text:
%md
## Iot-Broker Client example

This client use the Iot-Broker module to query and insert data into ontologies.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- port
- protocol
- iot_client (optional)
- iot_client_token (optional)

If we are executing the client inside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host      = "iotbrokerservice" (DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_HOST)
- port      = 19000              (DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_PORT)
- protocol  = "http"             (RestProtocols.HTTP.value)

If we are executing the client outside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host      = <instalatlion_host> ("www.onesaitplatform.online")
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True   (recomended)

msg.data:
Iot-Broker Client example

This client use the Iot-Broker module to query and insert data into ontologies.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- port
- protocol
- iot_client (optional)
- iot_client_token (optional)

If we are executing the client inside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host = “iotbrokerservice” (DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_HOST)
- port = 19000 (DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_PORT)
- protocol = “http” (RestProtocols.HTTP.value)

If we are executing the client outside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host = (“www.onesaitplatform.online”)
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True (recomended)

paragraphs.text:
%python
import json
import onesaitplatform.common.config as DefaultConfig
from onesaitplatform.enum import RestProtocols
from onesaitplatform.iotbroker import IotBrokerClient

paragraphs.title: Credentials
paragraphs.text:
%python# Set credentials
IOT_CLIENT = "RestaurantTestClient"
IOT_CLIENT_TOKEN = "0a42c0ba12254a2db048e9d927a61f47"

paragraphs.title: Create Iot-Broker Client from inside
paragraphs.text:
%python
# From inside OnesaitPlatform Network:
HOST = DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_HOST
PORT = DefaultConfig.IOT_BROKER_PORT
PROTOCOL = RestProtocols.HTTP.value # or "http"

iotClient = IotBrokerClient(HOST, PORT, iot_client=IOT_CLIENT, iot_client_token=IOT_CLIENT_TOKEN)
iotClient.protocol = PROTOCOL
print(iotClient)

msg.data: Client.IotBrokerClient(iot_client=RestaurantTestClient, iot_client_token=0a42c0ba12254a2db048e9d927a61f47, protocol=http, avoid_ssl_certificate=False, iot_clientId=RestaurantTestClient:PythonClient, host=iotbrokerservice, session_key=None, is_connected=False, port=19000)

paragraphs.title: Create Iot-Broker Client from outside
paragraphs.text:
%python
# From outside OnesaitPlatform Network:
HOST = "www.onesaitplatform.online"

iotClient = IotBrokerClient(HOST, iot_client=IOT_CLIENT, iot_client_token=IOT_CLIENT_TOKEN)
iotClient.avoid_ssl_certificate = True
print(iotClient)

msg.data: Client.IotBrokerClient(iot_client=RestaurantTestClient, iot_client_token=0a42c0ba12254a2db048e9d927a61f47, protocol=https, avoid_ssl_certificate=True, iot_clientId=RestaurantTestClient:PythonClient, host=www.onesaitplatform.online, session_key=None, is_connected=False, port=None)

paragraphs.title: Start connection
paragraphs.text:
%python
# Start connection
ok_join, res_join = iotClient.join()
print("Connection started: {} - with session key: {}".format(ok_join, res_join))

msg.data: Connection started: True with session key: {u'sessionKey': u'ae6ee281-bf84-4f2b-8e00-503b50c82c57'}

paragraphs.title: Query data
paragraphs.text:
%python
query = "select * from Restaurants limit 3"
ok_query, results_query = iotClient.query(ontology="Restaurants", query=query, query_type="SQL")
print("Query success: {}".format(ok_query))
print("Query results:")
for res in results_query:
    print(res)
    print("*")

paragraphs.title: Query data
paragraphs.text:
%python
query = "db.Restaurants.find().limit(3)"
ok_query, results_query = iotClient.query(ontology="Restaurants", query=query, query_type="NATIVE")
print("Query success: {}".format(ok_query))
print("Query results:")
for res in results_query:
    print(res)
    print("*")

paragraphs.title: Query data in batch
paragraphs.text:
%python
query_batch = "select c from Restaurants as c"
ok_query, results_query = iotClient.query_batch(ontology="Restaurants", query=query_batch, query_type="SQL", batch_size=50)
print("Query success: {}".format(ok_query))
print("Query results:")
for res in results_query[:3]:
    print(res)
    print("*")
print("... to {}".format(len(results_query)))

paragraphs.title: Insert data

paragraphs.text:
%python
ok_insert, res_insert = iotClient.insert("RestaurantTest", new_restaurants)
print("Inserted data: {} - Info: {}".format(ok_insert, res_insert))

msg.data: (True, {u'id': u'5cd131c0e336fd000bc77f9e'})

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Api-Manager Client example

This client use the Api-Manager module to manage and call APIs REST.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- port
- protocol
- user_token (optional)

If we are executing the client inside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host      = "apimnagerservice" (DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_HOST)
- port      = 19100              (DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_PORT)
- protocol  = "http"             (RestProtocols.HTTP.value)

If we are executing the client outside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host      = <instalatlion_host> ("www.onesaitplatform.online")
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True   (recomended)

msg.data:
Api-Manager Client example

This client use the Api-Manager module to manage and call APIs REST.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- port
- protocol
- user_token (optional)

If we are executing the client inside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host = “apimnagerservice” (DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_HOST)
- port = 19100 (DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_PORT)
- protocol = “http” (RestProtocols.HTTP.value)

If we are executing the client outside OnesaitPlatform installation network, it can be setted to:
- host = (“www.onesaitplatform.online”)
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True (recomended)

paragraphs.text:
%python
import json
import onesaitplatform.common.config as DefaultConfig
from onesaitplatform.enum import RestProtocols
from onesaitplatform.apimanager import ApiManagerClient

paragraphs.title: Credentials
paragraphs.text:
%python
USER_TOKEN = "b32522cd73e84ddda519f1dff9627f40"

paragraphs.title: Create Api-Manager Client from inside
paragraphs.text:
%python
# From inside OnesaitPlatform Network
HOST = DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_HOST
PORT = DefaultConfig.API_MANAGER_PORT
PROTOCOL = RestProtocols.HTTP.value # or "http"

apiClient = ApiManagerClient(HOST, PORT)
apiClient.protocol = PROTOCOL
print(apiClient)

msg.data: Client.ApiManagerClient(protocol=http, avoid_ssl_certificate=False, token=None, host=apimanagerservice, is_connected=False, port=19100)

paragraphs.title: Create Api-Manager Client from outside
paragraphs.text:
%python
# From outside OnesaitPlatform Network:
HOST = "www.onesaitplatform.online"

apiClient = ApiManagerClient(HOST)
apiClient.avoid_ssl_certificate = True
print(apiClient)

msg.data: Client.ApiManagerClient(protocol=https, avoid_ssl_certificate=True, token=None, host=www.onesaitplatform.online, is_connected=False, port=None)

paragraphs.title: Set token
paragraphs.text:
%python
apiClient.setToken(USER_TOKEN) #or apiClient.token = USER_TOKEN
print(apiClient.token)

msg.data: b32522cd73e84ddda519f1dff9627f40

paragraphs.title: Find APIs
paragraphs.text:
%python
ok_find, res_find = apiClient.find("RestaurantsAPI", "Created", "analytics")
print("API finded: {}".format(ok_find))
print("Api info:")
print(res_find)

msg.data:
API finded: True
Api info:
[{u'category': u'EDUCATION', u'status': u'CREATED', u'creationDate': u'04/16/2019 13:01:03', u'endpoint': u'https://development.onesaitplatform.com/api-manager/server/api/v1/RestaurantsAPI', u'description': u'', u'isPublic': None, u'userId': u'analytics', u'authentication': None, u'version': 1, u'identification': u'RestaurantsAPI', u'imageType': None, u'operations': [{u'endpoint': None, u'description': u'id', u'headers': [], u'identification': u'RestaurantsAPI_GET', u'postProcess': None, u'path': u'/{id}', u'operation': u'GET', u'queryParams': [{u'headerType': u'PATH', u'dataType': u'STRING', u'description': u'', u'value': None, u'condition': None, u'name': u'id'}]}, {u'endpoint': None, u'description': u'all', u'headers': [], u'identification': u'RestaurantsAPI_GETAll', u'postProcess': None, u'path': u'', u'operation': u'GET', u'queryParams': []}], u'externalApi': False, u'endpointExt': None, u'type': u'PRIVATE', u'ontologyId': u'MASTER-Ontology-Restaurant-1', u'metainf': u''}]

paragraphs.title: List APIs
paragraphs.text:
%python
ok_list, res_list = apiClient.list("analytics")
print("APIs listed {}".format(ok_list))
print("Apis info:")
for api in res_list:
    print(api)
    print("*")

paragraphs.title: Make API request
paragraphs.text:
%python
id_restaurant = "5cb032da23d35d000111809d"
ok_request, res_request = apiClient.request(method="GET", name="RestaurantsAPI/" + id_restaurant, version=1, body=None)
print("API request: {}".format(ok_request))
print("Api request:")
print(res_request)

msg.data:
API request: True
Api request:
[{u'value': {u'_id': u'5cb032da23d35d000111809d', u'Restaurant': {u'cuisine': u'Irish', u'name': u'Dj Reynolds Pub And Restaurant', u'restaurant_id': u'30191841', u'grades': [{u'date': u'2014-09-06T00:00:00Z', u'grade': u'A', u'score': 2}, {u'date': u'2013-07-22T00:00:00Z', u'grade': u'A', u'score': 11}, {u'date': u'2012-07-31T00:00:00Z', u'grade': u'A', u'score': 12}, {u'date': u'2011-12-29T00:00:00Z', u'grade': u'A', u'score': 12}], u'address': {u'building': u'351', u'street': u'West   57 Street', u'zipcode': u'10019', u'coord': [-73.98513559999999, 40.7676919]}, u'borough': u'Manhattan'}}}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
## File-Manager Client example

This client use the File-Manager module to upload and download binnary files.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- user_token (optional - Bearer ...)

It can be setted to:
- host      = <instalatlion_host> ("www.onesaitplatform.online")
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True   (recomended)

msg.data:
File-Manager Client example

This client use the File-Manager module to upload and download binnary files.

To configure this client is necessary to set te following atributtes:
- host
- user_token (optional - Bearer …)

It can be setted to:
- host = (“www.onesaitplatform.online”)
- avoid_ssl_certificate = True (recomended)

paragraphs.text:
%python
from onesaitplatform.files import FileManager

paragraphs.title: Credentials
paragraphs.text:
%python
USER_TOKEN = "Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Z7t2AmQjlm0c4ug507N7NZy3YRcr8-TVB4mxgRWx-nk"

paragraphs.title: Create File-Manager Client
paragraphs.text:
%python
HOST = "www.onesaitplatform.online"
fileClient = FileManager(host=HOST, user_token=USER_TOKEN)
fileClient.avoid_ssl_certificate = True
print(fileClient)

msg.data: FileManager(user_token=Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Z7t2AmQjlm0c4ug507N7NZy3YRcr8-TVB4mxgRWx-nk, host=www.onesaitplatform.online, protocol=https, avoid_ssl_certificate=True)

paragraphs.text:
%python
# Create dumy file
with open("dummy_file.txt", "wb") as dfile:
    dfile.write("This is a dummy file!")
    
# Create dumy file
with open("dummy_file.txt", "rb") as dfile:
    data = dfile.readlines()
    print(data)

msg.data: ['This is a dummy file!']

paragraphs.title: Upload file
paragraphs.text:
%python
uploaded, info = fileClient.upload_file("dummy_file.txt", "./dummy_file.txt")
print("Uploaded file: {}".format(uploaded))
print("Information: {}".format(info))

paragraphs.text:
%python
downloaded, info = fileClient.download_file("5cd13d9df2df81000b8f494e")
print("Downloaded file: {}".format(downloaded))
print("Information: {}".format(info))
